page.title: 11TOURISM IN GLASSARY
page.content: ALTHOUGH THERE ARE NO HOTELS OR BOARDING HOUSES IN THE VILLAGE, MANY TOURISTS FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD VISIT GLASSARY EACH YEAR. MANY VISITORS COME TO ENJOY THE NATURAL BEAUTY OF THE LOCAL COUNTYSIDE BUT MOST VISITORS COME TO SEE THE CAIRNS, STANDING STONES AND CUP AND RING ROCKS WHICH ARE TO BE FOUND ALL OVER THIS AREA. THE CHURCHYARD TOO, HAS MANY VISITORS. SOME TO STUDY THE MANY OLD GRAVE STONES AND SOME TO TRY TO TRACE THEIR ANCESTORS. ONE RECENT VISITOR FROM AUSTRALIA WAS TRYING TO LOCATE THE GRAVE OF HER ANCESTOR WHO WAS HEAD TEACHER OF GLASSARY SCHOOL IN THE 1830'S. FISHERMEN ALSO VISIT THIS AREA BECAUSE OF THE MANY LOCHS AND RIVERS WHERE SALMON AND TROUT CAN OFTEN BE CAUGHT.
